intro: Hyphaene pyrifera, commonly known as the double-lobed palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its distinctive, fan-shaped leaves and clustered, spiny fruits. The plant produces large, yellowish-orange fruits that contain a single, hard-seed. Hyphaene pyrifera thrives in coastal and dry forest habitats, often growing in sandy or limestone soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
